title: You have been auto filled as _ do you accept.
body:
The OCE League of Legends community is quite small compared to others around the world so when it comes to ranked Auto-fill seems to always be active. This can raise problems when put into a role you are not confident with.

To help with this problem i suggest having the client tell you that "You have been auto filled as _ this game, do you accept?" and if the player accepts, everyone is happy, If he does not accept it puts him back in queue and black lists him from being put as that roles for X mins.

As a thank you for people being auto filled in a role, and to encourage people to play outside their usual role, there could be a small reward for players who agree to the auto fill constantly.

replies.body:
I tend to agree with CHEESYLEEKS on this one, sure autofill is annoying cos you cant play the role you want some of the time, but its really not that hard to learn a couple of champs for every role. 

If you can decline auto-fill, so many people will just decline and not care about any small rewards, (making sure they can be a 1 trick riven is more important to them)

just come to terms with auto-fill. 
A year ago we still had randomised positions when you joined a ranked game and it was first pick first served.  So you needed to know all the positions anyway. The current system is way better than that, so in theory there should be less complaints, not more. 

We are a small server, if we want to play the game we do just need to compromise, its not fair, but its better than being stuck with constant 300 ping in the NA server. 

Its a good idea, and I'm all for rewards, but auto-fill is necessary for the health of the queue, and having an option to decline it, (in my view) is the same as not even having it.

> A year ago we still had randomised positions when you joined a ranked game and it was first pick first served. So you needed to know all the positions anyway. The current system is way better than that"

Why do you think they changed the old system? (cause it was bad, and for people with lower end pcs / slow internet speed they didn't get the role they wanted) 

> its better than being stuck with constant 300 ping in the NA server. 

Also why are you stuck in Season 1,2,3 talking about "better than 300 ping". IMO I would rather connect to NA server and have 300 ping with 0 autofill. But hey, that's just me. {{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

> [{quoted}](name=Sylva,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=5EmgjmKJ,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2016-12-13T00:09:05.772+0000)

> Also why are you stuck in Season 1,2,3 talking about "better than 300 ping". IMO I would rather connect to NA server and have 300 ping with 0 autofill. But hey, that's just me. 

I believe account transfers are enabled again. 
If thats really what you'd prefer, i wont stop you. 

But for myself, i don't mind playing ADC or Support when no one else will, playing multiple positions actually makes you better at the game, becasue you learn to put yourself in the enemies shoes. 

Its quite a valuable tool ^^

> playing multiple positions actually makes you better at the game

Idk about that, I think playing multiple positions give you a better understanding of the game overall. You still need to have mechanics and a positive attitude though. 
P.S - What do you mean exactly by 
> "better "

Prediction, is what I'm talking about. 

If I'm Aurelion Sol, and I'm vs a Kalista. Because I play Kalista, I know what she must be thinking, and because I know what she is thinking, i can predict her movements and manipulate the situation to my advantage. 
The reverse is also true. if I'm Kalista, I know what the Sol is thinking and how he might react to my movements.

That can only be a positive thing. I cant think of any way that knowing the enemy movements would disadvantage you. Therefore it can only make your playing "better".

A one trick Riven or Vayne etc, might know that champion inside out, but if they cant predict what the opponent is going to do (or can do), then they may find themselves suddenly unable to escape from a trap that they couldn't see coming. 

The same is true of roles, the dynamic of bot lane is incredibly different to the dynamic of mid lane. A mid laner that has no experience of the bot lane dynamic, might roam bot expecting it to pan out like ganks in the mid lane, but suddenly find themselves in hot water because they didn't fully understand the situation. 

_____________________

But really it all boils down to:
There are no disadvantages about being able to play all roles. But there are disadvantages in only playing one role.

Therefore, being able to play multiple roles, can only be "better" than not being able to play multiple roles.
Just learn to play at least 3-4 champs in every role its really not that hard
